task.title: Fix Shorts Between Hot and Ground
task.shortdesc: Identify and remove short circuits that occur when hot wires accidentally contact grounded surfaces.

prereq.p: You need a soldering iron, solder wick or desoldering pump, and wire cutters.

step.cmd: Inspect solder connections for shorts to ground.

substep.cmd: Look for loose wire strands bridging from hot lugs to the pot casing or output jack sleeve.
substep.stepresult: Stray copper strands appear as thin filaments touching metal surfaces.

substep.cmd: Check for solder blobs connecting hot terminals to grounded surfaces.
substep.stepresult: Excess solder may create bridges between adjacent lugs or to the pot casing.

substep.cmd: Verify capacitor leads do not touch the pot casing or control plate.
substep.stepresult: Bent or long leads may accidentally contact grounded metal.

choices.choice: Trim stray wire strands with wire cutters.
Remove excess solder with solder wick or desoldering pump.
Bend capacitor leads away from grounded surfaces.

step.stepresult: The hot connection should have no contact with grounded surfaces.

step.cmd: Re-solder any connections that required trimming or cleaning.
step.stepresult: Fresh solder should be shiny and smooth with no bridges to ground.

result.p: If sound is restored after removing shorts, accidental grounding caused the problem.
